metadata.title: CVE-2024-26643 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: mark set as dead when unbinding anonymous set withtimeout While the rhashtable set gc runs asynchronously, a race allows itto collect elements from anonymous sets with timeouts while it is beingreleased from the commit path. Mingi Cho originally reported this issue ina different path in 6.1.x with a pipapo set with low timeouts which is notpossible upstream since 7395dfacfff6 ("netfilter: nf_tables: use timestampto check for set element timeout"). Fix this by setting on the dead flagfor anonymous sets to skip async gc in this case. According to 08e4c8c5919f("netfilter: nf_tables: mark newset as dead on transaction abort"), Florianplans to accelerate abort path by releasing objects via workqueue,therefore, this sets on the dead flag for abort path too.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26643` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-42-generic - 6.5.0-42.42
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-42-generic - 6.5.0-42.42
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-42-generic-64k - 6.5.0-42.42
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1022-aws - 6.5.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1023-azure - 6.5.0-1023.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1023-gcp - 6.5.0-1023.25
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1018-laptop - 6.5.0-1018.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-42-lowlatency - 6.5.0-42.42.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-42-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-42.42.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1025-oracle - 6.5.0-1025.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1025-oracle-64k - 6.5.0-1025.25
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1019-raspi - 6.5.0-1019.22
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1016-starfive - 6.5.0-1016.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-42.42').
linux-aws package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1022.22').
linux-azure package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1023.24').
linux-gcp package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1023.25').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-laptop package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1018.21').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-42.42.1').
linux-oracle package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1025.25').
linux-raspi package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1019.22').
linux-starfive package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1016.17').
